column1: Mariano Comense (Brianzöö: Marian [maˈrjãː]) is a town and comune in the province of Como
column4: 600 inhabitants and is one of the most important cities of the Brianza. It received the honorary title of city with a presidential decree on February 29
column5: 1996. It is served by Mariano Comense railway station.

column2: of medieval origins but rebuilt in 1583
